words.meaning: 议论；评论; v. 表达意见
vi. 交流，交际 v. 表达；传达
舒适 vt. 使舒适，安慰

words.example: It is logical to start with the easiest question.

words.meaning: 前部；前面；前线 adj. 前部的；前面的

words.example: She is friendly and outgoing.

words.meaning: 妥协；折中；（v. ）妥协，达成和解
words.example: They finally reached a compromise after a long discussion.
A mass of students gathered in the playground.
She used a needle to sew the button on the shirt.

words.meaning: 平的；朴素的；清楚的；平原
words.example: The land here is flat and plain.
The scientist collected a lot of data for the experiment.
She knows how to handle difficult problems.
The school has a new policy on homework.
I’d like to reserve a table for two.
Thailand is famous for its beautiful beaches.
Apple is a countable noun.
He didn’t dare to speak in front of so many people.
She moved with great grace.
Eating more vegetables makes you healthier.
He made a request for help.
She scanned the article quickly before class.
You should not alter the plan without permission.
This is a compound sentence.
The word is derived from Latin.
He is an easygoing person and gets along with everyone.
He is a handsome young man.
She believes her grandmother is in heaven.
The prefix “un-” means not.
He worked like a superman to finish the task.
You should tell me sth. important.
The suffix “-ful” means full of.

phrases.meaning: 计划/打算/有迹象即将发生
去看看（表示两个连续动作）
phrases.example: Go and see what is happening outside.
Keep in mind that practice makes perfect.

phrases.phrase: touch a person on the head
phrases.example: In some countries, you shouldn’t touch a person on the head.
Students must follow the rules at school.
You had better not stay up too late.
She got used to getting up early.

phrases.meaning: 天书；神书（字面：天空之书）
phrases.example: The ancient text was like a book of the sky to ordinary people.
By God's grace, we arrived safely.
He will come back next week.

phrases.meaning: 重要的事情（形容词后置）
phrases.example: I have sth. important to tell you.

patterns.meaning: 应该有某物（表示建议或必要）
patterns.example: There should be more trees in the city.

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.wrong: He can swims.
mistakes.correct: He can swim.
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.correct: He can't be at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: You must hand in your homework on time.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句
grammar.definition: 用yes或no回答的疑问句，通常将助动词、be动词或情态动词放在主语前。
grammar.structure: 助动词/Be动词/情态动词 + 主语 + 动词(原形) + 其他?
usage: be动词开头：Are you a student? — Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.
助动词开头：Do you like English? — Yes, I do. / No, I don't.
情态动词开头：Can you swim? — Yes, I can. / No, I can't.
回答要与问句保持一致

mistakes.wrong: Does he likes music?
mistakes.correct: Does he like music?
mistakes.explanation: does后面动词要用原形

mistakes.wrong: Are you a teacher? — Yes, you are.
mistakes.correct: Are you a teacher? — Yes, I am.
mistakes.explanation: 回答时主语要变换，you变I

mistakes.wrong: Do you can swim?
mistakes.correct: Can you swim?
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词can不能与do连用

examples: Is she your sister? — Yes, she is.
Did you finish your homework? — No, I didn't.

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词/系动词提前）
sub_topics.definition: 通过提前助动词或be动词构成
usage: 用于提问

sub_topics.title: be动词与助动词的区分
sub_topics.definition: be动词本身可提前，实义动词需助动词
usage: 构成疑问或否定

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（do/does/did）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成
sub_topics.definition: 将助动词或系动词提前构成疑问句。
sub_topics.structure: 助动词/系动词 + 主语 + 动词
usage: 询问信息

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：助动词/系动词提前
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：do/does/did + 主语 + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成方法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词do/does/did提前）
一般疑问句的构成规则
一般疑问句：助动词提前

grammar.title: 否定句
grammar.definition: 表示否定意义的句子
grammar.structure: be not / do not
usage: 注意助动词

sub_topics.title: 否定句：助动词 + not
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

grammar.title: 固定搭配辨析
grammar.definition: 指某些词语在长期使用中形成固定组合，搭配不可随意更换，需要整体记忆。
grammar.structure: 动词/形容词/名词 + 固定介词或副词
usage: 不能随意替换其中的介词或副词
意义往往不同于单个词义简单相加
常见于动词短语和习惯表达

grammar.title: 一般将来时
grammar.definition: 表示将来某一时刻将要发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示将来经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + will/shall + 动词原形 或 主语 + be going to + 动词原形
usage: will表示临时决定或预测：I will help you.
be going to表示计划或有迹象要发生：Look at the clouds. It's going to rain.
shall用于第一人称的提议：Shall we go now?

mistakes.wrong: I will going to school.
mistakes.correct: I will go to school.
mistakes.explanation: will后面直接加动词原形，不加to或-ing

mistakes.wrong: She is go to leave.
mistakes.correct: She is going to leave.
mistakes.explanation: be going to结构中，be动词后接going

examples: We will have a meeting tomorrow.
I'm going to visit my uncle next week.
It will be sunny this afternoon.

grammar.title: 现在进行时
grammar.definition: 表示现在正在进行的动作，也可表示现阶段正在进行或即将发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + am/is/are + 动词-ing
usage: 表示说话时正在进行的动作：He is reading a book now.
表示现阶段正在进行的动作：She is learning French this year.
表示即将发生的动作（常用go, come, leave等）：I am leaving tomorrow.
与always连用表示赞扬或不满：He is always helping others.

mistakes.wrong: She is play the piano.
mistakes.correct: She is playing the piano.
mistakes.explanation: be动词后面要用动词的-ing形式

mistakes.wrong: I am knowing the answer.
mistakes.correct: I know the answer.
mistakes.explanation: know是状态动词，一般不用进行时

examples: They are watching TV at the moment.
We are having an English class now.

sub_topics.title: 现在进行时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示正在进行或现阶段正在发生的动作
usage: 表示说话时正在发生的动作
表示现阶段持续的动作
examples: She is studying English these days.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.wrong: I have see the movie.
mistakes.correct: I have seen the movie.
mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.correct: I bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果

grammar.title: 状语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作状语的从句，用来修饰主句，表示时间、条件、原因、目的、结果、让步等。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 从句，主句（从句可前可后）
usage: 时间状语从句：when, while, before, after, as soon as, until等
条件状语从句：if, unless (= if not)
原因状语从句：because, since, as
让步状语从句：although/though, even if/though
结果状语从句：so...that..., such...that...

mistakes.wrong: If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.correct: If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.explanation: 在条件状语从句中，用一般现在时表将来

mistakes.wrong: Although he is tired, but he keeps working.
mistakes.correct: Although he is tired, he keeps working.
mistakes.explanation: although和but不能同时使用

mistakes.wrong: Because I was ill, so I didn't go to school.
mistakes.correct: Because I was ill, I didn't go to school.
mistakes.explanation: because和so不能同时使用

examples: I will call you as soon as I arrive.
Unless you work hard, you won't succeed.
He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.

sub_topics.title: when + 从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: how to + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

grammar.title: 现在分词 (v. -ing作形容词/副词)
grammar.definition: 由动词-ing形式构成，可以作定语、状语、表语和宾语补足语，表示主动或正在进行。
grammar.structure: 动词-ing
usage: 作定语（表主动/进行）：the sleeping baby = the baby who is sleeping
作状语：Hearing the news, she jumped with joy.
作表语：The movie is exciting.
作宾语补足语：I saw him running.

mistakes.wrong: The news is excited.
mistakes.correct: The news is exciting.
mistakes.explanation: 修饰物用-ing（令人...的），修饰人用-ed（感到...的）

mistakes.wrong: Seen from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.correct: Seeing from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.explanation: 分词的逻辑主语要与句子主语一致

examples: Walking along the street, I met an old friend.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时间发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示过去经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式（be动词用was/were）
usage: 表示过去发生的动作：I visited my grandma yesterday.
表示过去存在的状态：He was a teacher ten years ago.
表示过去的习惯：When I was young, I often played football.

mistakes.wrong: I go to Beijing last year.
mistakes.correct: I went to Beijing last year.
mistakes.explanation: 有过去时间标志词（last year），动词要用过去式

mistakes.wrong: Did you went there?
mistakes.correct: Did you go there?
mistakes.explanation: did后面的动词要用原形

examples: She bought a new dress yesterday.
They were happy at the party.
I didn't watch TV last night.

sub_topics.title: 一般过去时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作
usage: 与过去时间状语连用

grammar.title: 可数名词语不可数名词
keywords: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.definition: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.structure: 可数名词与不可数名词

sub_topics.title: 可数名词与不可数名词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中修饰名词或代词的从句，通常紧跟在被修饰的词（先行词）之后。
grammar.structure: 先行词 + 关系词(who/which/that/whose/where/when) + 从句
usage: who/that指人：The man who/that is talking is my father.
which/that指物：The book which/that I bought is interesting.
whose表所属：The girl whose mother is a doctor is my friend.
where指地点：This is the school where I studied.
when指时间：I still remember the day when I met you.

mistakes.wrong: The man which is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.correct: The man who/that is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是人时，用who或that，不用which

mistakes.wrong: The book who I bought is good.
mistakes.correct: The book which/that I bought is good.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是物时，用which或that，不用who

mistakes.wrong: This is the place where I visited.
mistakes.correct: This is the place which/that I visited.
mistakes.explanation: visit是及物动词，需要宾语，用which/that而非where

examples: I have a friend who can speak five languages.
The movie that we saw last night was exciting.
I'll never forget the day when I graduated.

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（that引导）
sub_topics.definition: that引导从句修饰名词
usage: that作主语或宾语
examples: The book that I like is interesting.

sub_topics.title: 名词 + 定语从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词的从句，通常放在名词后
sub_topics.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句
usage: that / who / which 等
examples: The boy who is reading is my brother.

grammar.title: 宾语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作宾语的从句，通常放在主句谓语动词、介词或形容词之后。
grammar.structure: 主句 + 引导词(that/wh-/if/whether) + 陈述语序
usage: that引导（可省略）：I think (that) he is right.
wh-词引导：I don't know what his name is.
if/whether引导：I wonder if/whether he will come.
注意宾语从句要用陈述语序

mistakes.wrong: I don't know where is he.
mistakes.correct: I don't know where he is.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句要用陈述语序，不用疑问语序

mistakes.wrong: He asked me that where I lived.
mistakes.correct: He asked me where I lived.
mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问词引导时不需要that

mistakes.wrong: I wonder if will he come.
mistakes.correct: I wonder if he will come.
mistakes.explanation: if引导的宾语从句要用陈述语序

examples: I believe that you can do it.
Could you tell me how I can get to the station?
I'm not sure whether it will rain tomorrow.

sub_topics.title: what + 宾语从句
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 宾语从句作宾语
sub_topics.definition: 用句子作宾语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 连词 + 从句
usage: 表达观点事实
examples: I know that he is right.

grammar.title: 介宾短语
grammar.definition: 介宾短语
grammar.structure: 介词后接名词或动名词

sub_topics.title: 介词后接名词或动名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: 常考语法点

sub_topics.title: 介词短语
sub_topics.definition: 由介词+宾语构成
usage: 作定语或状语

sub_topics.title: 介词后接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后必须接名词或动名词
usage: 表示时间地点方式等

grammar.title: 连词
grammar.definition: 连词
grammar.structure: 句子连接词

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 形容词/副词最高级
grammar.definition: 用于三者或三者以上的比较，表示'最...'的意思。
grammar.structure: the + 形容词/副词最高级 + (in/of范围)
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-est（tall→tallest, big→biggest）
多音节和部分双音节词：most + 原级（beautiful→most beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→best, bad/badly→worst, many/much→most
常与in+地点/of+范围连用

mistakes.wrong: He is tallest in our class.
mistakes.correct: He is the tallest in our class.
mistakes.explanation: 形容词最高级前要加the

mistakes.wrong: She is the most youngest.
mistakes.correct: She is the youngest.
mistakes.explanation: young是单音节词，最高级是youngest，不用most

mistakes.wrong: This is the best book of all the book.
mistakes.correct: This is the best book of all the books.
mistakes.explanation: of all后面的名词要用复数

examples: He is the tallest student in our class.
This is the most interesting book I have ever read.
She sings (the) best of all the students.

sub_topics.title: 比较级的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于比较两者
usage: 两者比较
常与than连用
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 名词
grammar.definition: 名词
grammar.structure: 名词性用法判断

sub_topics.title: 名词性用法判断
sub_topics.definition: 主语的含义

grammar.title: 代词 (人称/物主/反身/指示)
grammar.definition: 用来代替名词或名词短语的词，包括人称代词、物主代词、反身代词、指示代词等。
grammar.structure: 根据在句中的成分选择相应形式
usage: 人称代词主格（作主语）：I, you, he, she, it, we, they
人称代词宾格（作宾语）：me, you, him, her, it, us, them
形容词性物主代词（后接名词）：my, your, his, her, its, our, their
名词性物主代词（独立使用）：mine, yours, his, hers, its, ours, theirs
反身代词：myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves

mistakes.wrong: Me and Tom are friends.
mistakes.correct: Tom and I are friends.
mistakes.explanation: 作主语用主格I，且把自己放后面

mistakes.wrong: This is her, not my.
mistakes.correct: This is hers, not mine.
mistakes.explanation: 独立使用时用名词性物主代词

mistakes.wrong: He hurt hisself.
mistakes.correct: He hurt himself.
mistakes.explanation: 反身代词是himself，不是hisself

examples: This is my book. That is yours.

sub_topics.title: pronoun
sub_topics.definition: 代词，用来代替名词或名词短语，避免重复，使句子更简洁

grammar.title: 主谓一致
grammar.definition: 句子的主语和谓语动词在人称和数上要保持一致。
grammar.structure: 单数主语 + 单数谓语 / 复数主语 + 复数谓语
usage: 就近原则：There is/are..., Either...or..., Neither...nor..., Not only...but also...
就远原则：主语 + with/as well as/together with/except/besides + 名词
不可数名词作主语，谓语用单数：Water is important.
动名词/不定式作主语，谓语用单数：Swimming is good for health.
集体名词：family, class, team等看作整体用单数，看作成员用复数

mistakes.wrong: The teacher with his students are in the classroom.
mistakes.correct: The teacher with his students is in the classroom.
mistakes.explanation: with引导的部分不是主语，主语是teacher，谓语用单数

mistakes.wrong: Neither you nor he are right.
mistakes.correct: Neither you nor he is right.
mistakes.explanation: neither...nor...就近原则，he是单数，用is

mistakes.wrong: Maths are my favorite subject.
mistakes.correct: Maths is my favorite subject.
mistakes.explanation: 学科名词（maths, physics, news等）虽以s结尾，但作单数

examples: Not only he but also I am a student.
The police are looking for the thief.

sub_topics.title: 主语与谓语一致
sub_topics.definition: 谓语动词与主语在人称和数上保持一致
sub_topics.structure: 单数主语 + 单数谓语
usage: 动名词作主语视为单数

sub_topics.title: 主谓一致（第三人称单数）
sub_topics.definition: 当主语为第三人称单数时，谓语动词需使用第三人称单数形式
sub_topics.structure: 主语（第三人称单数） + 动词三单形式
usage: 主语是 he / she / it
主语是单数名词
动名词或不定式作主语视为单数

grammar.title: had better句型
grammar.definition: 表示建议，含有强烈的建议或警告意味。
grammar.structure: had better + 动词原形
usage: 常用于建议、劝告，特别是当做某事可能会带来不良后果时。
语气较为强烈，表示如果不按建议做，可能会有不好的后果。
examples: You had better study for the exam.
She had better not be late for the meeting.

grammar.title: would表示委婉请求（多用于疑问句）
grammar.definition: would常用来表示请求、建议或表示假设，语气比will更为委婉。
grammar.structure: would + 主语 + 动词原形
usage: 通常用于请求或建议中，特别是在要求别人做某事时。
可用于对现在或未来的假设，语气比will更柔和。
examples: Would you please help me with this task?
Would you mind closing the window?

grammar.title: 词法与句法
grammar.definition: 词法（morphology）是研究单词及其构成部分的学问；句法（syntax）是研究单词如何组合成句子的学问。
grammar.structure: 词法关注词的形式变化，句法关注词的排列顺序。
usage: 词法主要处理词的构成，如词根、词缀等。
句法主要处理词和词之间如何结合形成正确的句子结构。
examples: The word 'unhappiness' involves both a prefix and a suffix (un- and -ness).
In English, word order in sentences generally follows Subject-Verb-Object (SVO) structure.

grammar.title: 单复数
grammar.definition: 名词的单数和复数形式。单数指一个，复数指多个。
grammar.structure: 单数形式通常为词根，复数形式一般通过加-s或-es构成。
usage: 可数名词的复数形式通过加-s或-es构成。
不可数名词没有复数形式。

grammar.title: 双重所有格
grammar.definition: 表示两个所有者或多个所有者的所有格结构。
grammar.structure: 名词 + of + 名词所有格
usage: 常用于表示两个或更多的拥有关系。
双重所有格结构通常用于文学或正式表达。
examples: The Queen's jewels are the symbol of England's history.
The teacher's idea of the student's work was very positive.

grammar.title: 名词作定语
grammar.definition: 名词用作修饰另一个名词，说明该名词的特征或用途。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 名词（作定语）
usage: 用名词修饰名词时，后一个名词通常作为修饰名词的具体内容。
常见的名词作定语结构包括复合名词。

grammar.title: y结尾形容词比较级变化规则
grammar.definition: 以-y结尾的形容词在构成比较级时，先去掉-y，加-er。
grammar.structure: 形容词 + er
usage: 适用于以辅音字母+ y结尾的形容词。
例如，'happy'变为'happier'。

grammar.title: 简单句与复合句
grammar.definition: 简单句包含一个主谓结构，复合句由两个或更多简单句通过连词连接组成。
grammar.structure: 简单句: 主语 + 谓语，复合句: 主句 + 从句（由连词连接）
usage: 简单句用于表达单一的意思。
复合句用于表达多个相关的意思。
examples: She reads books and listens to music. (复合句)

grammar.title: 复合词
grammar.definition: 由两个或更多词组成的新词，通常通过连接两个完整的单词来构成。
grammar.structure: 单词 + 单词
usage: 复合词的意思是由组成部分的意思结合而来的。
复合词可以是名词、动词、形容词等。

grammar.title: 派生词（词根 词缀）
grammar.definition: 通过在词根加上前缀或后缀形成新词，改变词的词性或意义。
grammar.structure: 词根 + 词缀
usage: 前缀和后缀可以改变词的意思或词性。
派生词用于增加词汇的丰富性。

grammar.title: 词根与词缀（后缀/前缀）
grammar.definition: 通过在词根加上前缀或后缀来形成新词，通常可以改变词的词性或意义。
grammar.structure: 词根 + 词缀（前缀或后缀）
usage: 前缀通常加在词根前面，用来改变词的意义。
后缀通常加在词根后面，常用来改变词的词性或构成不同的时态、复数等形式。

grammar.title: tense
grammar.definition: 时态用于表达动作或状态发生的时间，英语中有多种时态，表示不同的时间维度。
grammar.structure: 时态包括现在时、过去时、将来时等。
usage: 时态的选择取决于句子描述的时间背景。
英语中的时态主要包括：现在时、过去时、将来时、现在进行时、过去进行时等。
examples: I eat breakfast every day. (现在时)
She went to the store yesterday. (过去时)
We will travel to Paris next year. (将来时)
He is studying for his exams. (现在进行时)

grammar.title: need sth. to do sth.
grammar.definition: 需要某物做某事

grammar.title: good和 well 的比较级形式
grammar.definition: (good和 well 的比较级形式)较好的

grammar.title: 用于否定句或疑问句
grammar.definition: （用于否定句或疑问句）过去常常做某事
